Name: Support of a vase
Description: This ceramic of the Meroitic Period is characterised amongst others by the general absence of objects with flat bases, which explains the presences of numerous receptacle stands found in the necropoleis of the capital Meroe. The piece from Brussels comes from the excavations by J. Garstang in 1909-1910. Painted in yellow, red and blue, this beautiful stand in clay takes the form of the trunk of a palm tree, widened at the base and with a capital at the top.
